medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and RUQ abdominal pain for 3-4 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain is worse after eating and abates between meals. No other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or fevers were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gastric MALT treated with radiation, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, osteoarthritis. Previous surgical history includes TAH/BSO for fibroids, abdominoplasty, breast reduction, and operations for right hand contractures s/p MVA.
